multiple_choice.choice: Osteoarthritis causes joint pain. Rheumatoid arthritic causes bone pain.
Osteoarthritis is the result of synovial fluid accumulation. Rheumatoid arthritis is the result of cartilage deterioration.
Osteoarthritis is the result of cartilage deterioration. Rheumatoid arthritis is the result of calcium deficiency.
Osteoarthritis is the result of cartilage deterioration. Rheumatoid arthritis is the result of synovial membrane inflammation.

Incorrect. Osteoarthritis is the result of cartilage deterioration.
